boardgame.name: Davoss: A Setting for Abstract Dungeon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ten years ago, extraterrestrials devastated Earth. While they remained in space, the aliens established flying cities called Davosses from which their human collaborators rule the common people and do the aliens’ dirty work. While most aliens crushed all major powers, isolated groups of rebels continue to fight back.

Davoss is post-apoaclyptic alien-invasion setting for the Abstract Dungeon roleplaying game. It includes

A history of the setting
Details about the world today,
New traits
New foes
Optional setting rules
A complete adventure to start the rebels on their path to defeat their alien overlords.

boardgame.name: Mysteries of the Mists
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Four new monsters to challenge your players with and four new spells to encourage greater creativity in play

Three horrifying monsters from my recent 5e horror module The Howling Caverns:

The Gharblest (CR 3): A terrifying mix of the ruthless ferocity of a goblin and the raw power of a Barghest
Qalupalik (CR 3): Slinking from the frozen sea to drag unsuspecting prey into the endless abyss
Wereowl (CR 1): Swift and merciless but easily distracted by shiny things


And one appearing in my upcoming follow-up Colossus Wake:

Traitor’s Heart (CR 4): A black heart twisted by betrayal refuses to die; the heartbeat of death approaches


Four versatile new spells:

Song of Steel (2nd)
Speak with Stone (1st)
Temper Weapon (2nd)
Words Take Flight (1st)

boardgame.name: A Time For Sacrifice
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Time for Sacrifice is a Call of Cthulhu adventure book for the classic 1920s era, written for the 7th edition Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game. The book contains a series of five adventures set among the Mayan ruins scattered across Central and South America. Explore ancient ruins and investigate the strange phenomena surrounding their megalithic pyramids and structures. What mythos lie deep beneath the altars? Will it ever be safe to explore this strange world? Walk where they walked, read the stones they carved, study the gods they worshiped, unravel the mysteries they created. . . and make the sacrifices they made.

Back Cover
A Time for Sacrifice is a Call of Cthulhu adventure book for the classic 1920s era. The book contains a series of 5 adventures set in the Mayan ruins scattered across Central and South America, written for the 7th ed. Call of Cthulhu Role-Playing Game. Join in and explore the ancient ruins, and the strange phenomenon surrounding their mega-lithic pyramids and structures. What mythos lie deep within the alters, will it ever be safe to explore this strange world of theirs. Walk where they walked, read the stones they carved, study the gods they worshiped, learn the mysteries they created, and make the sacrifices, they made.

boardgame.name: The Basilisk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mid-Level Fantasy Adventure
Intended for 4 to 6 player characters of levels 6 to 8

RUMOURS SPEAK OF A VILE WIZARD WITH A PENCHANT FOR PETRIFACTIONS.
HE IS SAID TO DWELL IN HIS TOWER HOME, GUARDED BY HIS PETS & ALLIES.
CAN YOU STOP THIS FIEND BEFORE HE SOLIDIFES HIS HOLD ON THE VALLEY?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am happy to announce the release of “THE BASILISK”; a mid-level one-shot fantasy adventure intended for 4 to 6 seasoned adventurers of levels 6 to 8. This is another of my love letters to Old School Gaming, this time to the typewritten and mimeographed modules of the 1970 that I cut my teeth on! This also marks a bit of a milestone as it is the fifth compatible module I have released, intended for use with both OSR games (like OSRIC) and the modern 5E version of the world's greatest roleplaying game!

Synopsis: In this adventure your players are approached by a local magic shop merchant, Noval Gramarye, who requests their aid. It seems his future son in law, an alchemist, has been missing for nearly a month now, after he went off on a research trip. The young man was following up on tales of an ancient wizard’s abode known as Stoney Tower, believed to be located in the nearby forest. Rumours claimed the tower was somehow connected to petrifaction, the primary focus of Quintus’ alchemical research. He went searching for the tower in the forested foothills about a day’s ride to the south and east of their village, and has not been heard from since. His daughter set out a fortnight ago to find and return her love and she never returned either! The young couple’s wedding is mere days away and the merchant is beside himself with fear and worry. He begs the players to find his children and bring them home safe.

A lot is riding on the players completing their quest, for if they do not return with the couple in time for their nuptials, set for the coming weekend, the event will have to be cancelled. While this would be a sad occurrence, it is far worse than a mere personal tragedy because the missing young man’s father is none other than the leader of the local thieves’ guild; Vinnie the Butcher. The merchant is certain if the players don’t return with the happy couple in time to save their wedding day that his deposit on the hall won’t be the only thing he loses!

So it’s down to our heroes to rescue the missing couple, save their wedding date and make sure the father of the bride's gets out of this alive!

My core design goal for the module was to provide an authentic facsimile of an old typewritten adventure from the late 1970s; it is complete with nubby construction-paper covers, brads and staples, and black and white text and graphics throughout. I believe I achieved my goal, within the confines of still making the book readable and useable in the present day. However, since this book is being published in the year 2020, and I spent quite a lot of time working on the world maps and expanding and colourising the wonderful Dyson Logos dungeon map upon which Twr Caregog is based, I wanted to provide colour copies of those map for the benefit and enjoyment of the Game Master and their players, so this supplement also includes a separate COLOUR MAP BOOKLET, containing full colour illustrations of the maps from the adventure.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Aphelion's Gate Core Version
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game CORE Version RPG that introduces the Gamemaster and Players to The Galaxy of alien worlds and adventure. Aphelion's Gate uses the D10 Pentra System, of which only a 10-sided die is needed to play this easy to learn and play RPG. Strap on your force screen, grab your laser pistol, concentrate on your Psi, prepare your starship for Hypershot, and blast off from Aphelion’s Gate!

This CORE version of Aphelion's Gate includes higher level traits, advanced powers, rules for chases, starship combat, and advanced rules, allowing characters to ascend from 1st to 10th level.
boardgame.rpg: Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: The Aphelion Incident
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Aphelion Incident, an introductory level adventure for Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game, which introduces the Gamemaster and Players to The Galaxy of alien worlds and adventure. The Aphelion Incident uses the D10 Pentra System, of which only a 10-sided die is needed to play this RPG adventure. Strap on your force screen, grab your laser pistol, concentrate on your Psi, prepare your starship for Hypershot, and blast off from Aphelion’s Gate!
boardgame.rpg: Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: The Reign of Rage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Reign of Rage, a 1st level adventure for Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game, which introduces the Gamemaster and Players to The Galaxy of alien worlds and adventure. The Aphelion Incident uses the D10 Pentra System, of which only a 10-sided die is needed to play this RPG adventure. Strap on your force screen, grab your laser pistol, concentrate on your Psi, prepare your starship for Hypershot, and blast off from Aphelion’s Gate!
boardgame.rpg: Aphelion's Gate: A Science Fiction Roleplaying Game

boardgame.name: Danger on Roritura!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mostly-unspoiled South Pacific island of Roritura is a place of breathtaking tropical beauty. But the heroes, finding themselves castaways there, quickly learn that it’s also a place of deadly danger. As they try to find a way off the island and back to civilization, they encounter several ways they might meet their end; and a secret that, if left unchallenged, could mean Roritura’s end as well.

Danger on Roritura! is a short adventure for Thrill of the Thirties! 2D6 Adventure in the Pulp Era that could be used with other pulp-era games with a few adjustments; set in the mid-1930s.

boardgame.name: Mutandis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

During the lowest point in an interstellar war, the interstellar government became desperate to try anything to secure victory. To that end, the order was given to create a cadre of super-soldiers that could be sent on critical missions. The gambit was successful, and the interstellar government won the conflict. But the supermen who has helped make the victory possible were then seen as threats. Hunted and rounded up, they were dumped onto an uninhabited world where it was hoped they would no longer be a threat to interstellar society. Over the years, they were joined by all sorts of social outcasts, political prisoners, and misfits, but a spacelift by activists 50 years ago helped many of the planet’s strange inhabitants escape. And not all of them were recaptured.

Port of Call: Mutandis introduces Cepheus Engine and Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) players to this internment center in space. Inside is an overview of how the information would appear in a classified library database, physical planetary and system information, a brief history, a look at its technology and society, and a map of the planet.

Port of Call: Mutandis. Explore the interstellar government’s dirty little secret.

boardgame.name: Xan Armanis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet the Musician…

“Love slides along my body, beneath my clothes and down to the floor…”

Xan began his power ballad, waiting for the response he knew singing this song would generate.

“It's warm, somehow it feels kind of nice…”

Sure enough, the audience began to trigger their glowbes. Floating just above each concertgoer’s head and filling the space around them with a soft, shimmering light, they faded on as he built the song’s tempo. As the glowbes lit up more of the stadium, Xan let his eyes wander about the edges of the crowd. There! Off to the right, almost in the shadows. That same squat, balding man that seemed to be at each concert. Someone who probably wouldn’t be caught dead at a Xan Armanis concert unless he had an ulterior motive. Xan didn’t know what that motive was, but he was on to the interloper. Unknown to the man, Xan sang the last verse of the song to him:

“But I see you, I see you and soon we’ll meet.”

Xan Armanis clawed his way to the top of the subsector music scene from a hardscrabble existence under the glare of disapproving parents. But his enjoyment of fame was short-lived, as he found himself the unwitting participant in some sort of secret conspiracy…one that he knows will be the end of him if he doesn’t find a way to unravel it.

Dossier: Xan Armanis is a short character sketch for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG), although it’s usable with other systems with a little work. The file offers a brief character sketch, a personality sketch, character motivation, character stats usable for CE and the OSFRPG, and suggestions for using this manipulated entertainer in the Referee’s own universe.

boardgame.name: Happy Death Day
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A legendary paladin is holding a retirement party and the heroes are invited. Little do they know, the paladin's arch rival, the master vampire Lucian Hargrave, has a special retirement gift for the paladin.

The heroes must foil Lucian's plan and make it out alive in this one-page adventure that is filled with social intrigue and a horror-story twist.

This adventure is broadly intended for a group of 4-6 11th levl players but can be easily scaled up or down to suit your party.

boardgame.name: S-Rank Hunt: Snipperclips
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Most Dangerous Bounties Await

The Bounty Board has placed a new bounty on a dangerous foe. Are you the one who will collect it?

Snipperclips is a deadly elemental crab that has taken up home on a major shipping lane. Designed to challenge 5e parties of 4th-5th level, this S-Rank Hunt is a deadly CR 6 foe.

boardgame.name: Sunwarped Peaks
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Try to Find Some Shade

Sunwarped Peaks places a group of adventures in the path of a dangerous warlock who does the bidding of a deadly Patron known as the Prime Star. Duergan, the warlock in question, has begun a complex ritual in the mountains bordering the small village of Jartan's Shade. Massive mirrors and lenses twist light into unnatural portals that have created a gateway for lesser sun elementals to enter our world. Duergan will not rest until the portals are large enough to allow the Prime Star to enter our world and all land becomes sun scorched.

boardgame.name: End of Economy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your Money Won't Save You, Merchant

End of Economy thrusts players into the role of traveling merchants who arrive at a rural village where something insidious has happened. After an unfortunate accident, the restless spirit of a fellow wandering vendor has returned to the village and implanted unchecked greed within many of its villagers. They are completely immune to mundane weaponry. The merchants must learn what happened to the village and find a way to put the spirit to rest, one way or another.

boardgame.name: Magic Warfare: Arms, Armor, Spells, and Inventions for War in a Fantasy World
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This tome contains the collected information of the greatest tacticians, leaders, and generals from across the planes. Neatly organized into sections detailing subjects ranging from the use of known magic items, new magic items, spell theory, subterfuge, and specialized combatants this information is vital for any would be commander.

Contains:

New, by the rules, uses of existing spells and items.
New spells and magic items.
11 NEW creatures ranging from mobile weapon platforms to ice specialized assassins.
Example military engagements from around the planes.

boardgame.name: The Puppeteer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"They pull the strings of fate and the puppets perform."

Puppeteers are arcane performers that manipulate their enchanted companions with eldritch strings. A full 1st to 20th level class, the puppeteer is a balanced, well rounded but specialized, partial caster character class perfect for anyone interested in trying something new.

This product contains three archetypes for the class: the Ensemblist, Technician, and Ventriloquist. Each are highly focused disciplines of these mysterious wanderers.

boardgame.name: Bedtime Bestiary
boardgame.description:
from the itch.io page:
This is a game about a child's toys overcoming the terrible creatures of that child’s imagination. The protagonists of the story are a collection of children's toys who face danger together. The story should fit the imagination of a young child. The violence should not be graphic. All but the final encounter should be easy.

This game provides some alternate rules for character creation and story development, but otherwise uses the rule systems present in the 5th edition of the world’s most popular roleplaying game. A sample adventure and 4 new creatures are included.

boardgame.name: Beneath the Canals
boardgame.description:
from the itch.io page:

When the brave, greedy, desperate, or foolish venture beneath the stones and soft waves of Pentola they find themselves in a world made by Those Who Came Before, though shattered and marred by some ancient catastrophe which buckled the earth and loosed a seemingly endless flood of magical creatures and monsters into those halls of the dead.

So, what is this?
A System Agnostic mini-zine for exploring the Pentolan Catacombs

This single-sheet mini zine (zini, if you will) is an experiment in pushing the envelope for information density, layout, and gameable lore. It is written to be system agnostic, allowing you to take adventurers from any world and game into the catacombs described inside.

The inside spread describes how to procedurally generate dungeons on the fly or in advance complete with dozens of possible encounters and a back cover which is a quick reference for all the mechanics contained within.

boardgame.name: L.E.A.D.
boardgame.description:
L.E.A.D. stands for Lead Everyone Against Discrimination.

Inspired by the Tower of Babel, this board game has players use of multi-lingual lead types salvaged from an ancient print shop in Ipoh in the formation of a tower, while describing Malaysia's captivating heritage. Character cards depict people in a variety of different traditional styles of dress, and feature the a border of the words "Lead Everyone Against Discrimination" in 4 different languages, representing the melting pot nature of Malaysia.

Win the game by building the tower of lead types till it's completed with one lead type standing on top of the tower.

"Through this game, The Alphabet Press (TAP) hopes to enlighten more people on the history of letterpress printing in Malaysia and at the same time, highlight the diversity of languages spoken in this country – which has led to the existence of and need for these multi-lingual lead types."

boardgame.name: Azukail Games July 2020 Newsletter
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

boardgame.name: Bexim's Bazaar (Issue #19 - Jul 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bexim’s Bazaar is a monthly gaming magazine dedicated to RPGs and wargames… and occasionally a boardgame of interest to RPG/wargamers. GMs and players will find plenty of resources such as magic item cards, random tables, mini-adventures, and articles related to gaming as well as printable props to hand out in game. This issue contains over 100 pages of gaming content for a variety of genres and games, and gamers are welcome to submit their own content for future issues (info on submitting is found inside each issue).

Here are the contents for Bexim's Bazaar Issue #19:


Bexim's Bazaar Pages


Growder’s Tent - each month, 4 new magic item cards

Treana’s Trinkets - d20 random list of trinkets each month

The Dented Helm - each month, 4 new adventure hooks

Hewbue’s Used Books - each month, 10-15 new book titles and authors

Racker’s Auction House - 6 new auction items with lore each month

Veach’s Spellbooks - each month, 2 new spellbooks with descriptions/cost

Dolbin’s Scrolls - 3 new magic scrolls to print and provide to players each month

The Mystic Baker - each month, a new menu prop to print and hand out to players

Wanted Poster - each month, a new Wanted Dead or Alive poster with an NPC

Deed - new printable prop each month related to owning property


The Skirmish Table Pages


Hazel’s Weapons Emporium - Seller of the best (unofficial) weapons and accessories for Gaslands

Crumbling Headstones - An unofficial scenario for Relicblades skirmish wargame

Sibral's Arch - An unofficial scenario for Frostgrave skirmish wargame


GM Resources Pages


Heart Attack - An adventure for the Monster of the Week roleplaying game

DM Scotty's Wandering Monster - A stat block and image for 5e creature

A Swift Survey - A 5e mini-adventure and hand-made map from Bryan Swift

The Stuff of Dreams - A 5e mini-adventure from AdventureaWeek.com

Kev’s Lounge Paper Miniatures - two paper miniatures to print and make for your game


The Crafting Table Pages


Floating Skull Blood Shrine - Step-by-step instructions on making a fantasy themed shrine

Craft a Smelter - Step-by-step instructions on making a fantasy smelter

Castle Winterhawk Papercraft - Papercraft project from Fat Dragon Games

Incorrigible IMPS - a monthly comic strip

boardgame.name: Alpha Duo Roleplaying Basic Rules
boardgame.description:
from the itch.io page:
Alpha Duo Roleplaying: Basic Rules gives you all the tools you need to roleplay in multiple genres—in less than 10 pages!

This short, no-nonsense document lays out enough rules to support your beloved roleplaying adventures from any genre using a single, unified system that you can learn in one sitting. Use it for space pirates, classic fantasy, cyberpunk, or any other genre; if it's a story of adventure for a handful of protagonists, Alpha Duo has you covered!

Why choose Alpha Duo Roleplaying: Basic Rules over other systems?

Handles adventure stories in any genre
Easy to learn, but still robust and flexible
Doesn't assume combat as the primary form of conflict
Less accounting and bookkeeping than mainstream titles
Choose your own complexity level—even in the middle of gameplay!
It's free!
So download the file, grab some dice, and start your own customized adventure with your friends!

boardgame.name: Sorcerer: Seth Character Pack
boardgame.description:
As Seth, your Grimoire contains 7 sin cards, one for each of the 7 deadly sins. This new card type can be played for free. You spend an action to play a sin card, resolve its effect, and then perform a different action.

The effect of a sin card is minor, but after that effect, the sin card is attached to your character skill card. For an action, you can rain a hail of magical bullets down on your enemies, dealing collateral damage based on the number of sin cards you have collected.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sorcerer: Sigismund Character Pack
boardgame.description:
As Sigismund you will grow your order of vampires. You'll create newborn vampires and sanctuaries that give your vampires additional powers in certain battlefields.

Note: This Kickstarter exclusive Character Pack contains 20 cards. In addition to the standard avatar standee, skill cards and 10 card character deck, this pack contains 3 different sanctuary cards and 6 Coven Newborn tokens.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sorcerer: House of Petro Lineage Pack
boardgame.description:
With this lineage you will serve spirits called Loa. You will add cards to your temple (placing them under your House of Petro skill card), then use those cards to power new abilities as you channel a different Loa each turn.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sorcerer: Sword of Gabriel Lineage Pack
boardgame.description:
With Sword of Gabriel cards you gain light counters you can use to bless your minions (giving them +1 attack and essence) or to play Divine cards in reaction to your opponent.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sorcerer: Godforsaken Church Domain Pack
boardgame.description:
The minions of the Godforsaken Church are extremely aggressive. Many deal collateral damage, which the opponent must immediately assign to their minions or the battlefield.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sorcerer: Bewitched Woodland Domain Pack
boardgame.description:
The minions of the Bewitched Woodland work together and protect each other. They will allow you to heal your minions, gain omens, and ready your minions for additional attacks.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Alone in the Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Alone in the Dungeon is a hack of Takuma Okada's Alone Among the Stars. In it, you are a Dungeon Delver, a solitary individual who ventures into the depths below the surface seeking treasure.

A standard deck of 52 cards and a six-sided die are used for your explorations. You can make a journal of what you find along the way. If you want, you can keep the journal, but you don't have to.

boardgame.name: Javelins
boardgame.description:
JAVELINS is a relative of Amazons

Materials
10X10 square board
8 pawns in two colors
Supply of sticks (javelins)

Play
White moves first. Turns then alternate.

On a turn do two things.

1. Move your pawn in a straight line across any number of empty squares (orthogonally or diagonally). Pawns cannot move through other pawns. When moving orthogonally pawns cannot move through javelins. When moving diagonally pawns cannot move through 2 or more javelins whose ends meet at the same corner of a square.

2. The moved pawn throws a javelin orthogonally in a straight line across any number of empty squares and empty edges of squares. Javelins cannot be thrown through other javelins or pawns. If thrown vertically a javelin is placed horizontally along an empty edge of a square. If thrown horizontally a javelin is placed vertically along an empty edge of a square. No javelins are to be placed along the outer edge of the board.

Last player to move wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The Puzzle Box
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs obtain a mysterious puzzle box only to become trapped in an extradimensional mansion within it. There, they meet Glowdrop, a creature of light working against the mansion's owner Lumestin, an artist able to craft objects from light itself. After getting caught up in deadly conflict between the artist's apprentices, the PCs must stop a darknessspewing contraption to get to Lumestin and find their way home.

User summary:

For 8th level characters.

boardgame.name: Voyages of the Black Obelisk
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the layered worlds behind the gates. Welcome to the tunnel worlds drilled through the palimpset creation. Welcome to worlds of eternal champions and cosmic misunderstanding. Welcome to travelers in time and space. Welcome ill-conceived creators and accidental destroyers of worlds.

Is this document-in-writing the UVG2? Yes, no, sort of, maybe. It ramifies from the UVG. It explicitly builds on the same madcap anti-canon mythology.

But its origins are older and darker. I conceived of the Voyages of the Black Obelisk a year or two before I began writing the UVG. It was a dark time for me, when I struggled to make sense of workplace harassment. The original notes and structures of VotBO were grim, dark, and laced with despair. As I recovered, I found it harder to continue in that vein. Less and less did I want to plumb the shallows of sociopathology. More and more was I tempted by the absurdity of Zardoz and Barbarella and the Incal.

And yet, a fragment of that alien madness should remain, a reminder that curiosity yet kills cats.

User summary:

The document is a blend of in-setting fiction and game resources.
